segments.en: TOM presented himself before Aunt Polly, who was sitting by an open window in a pleasant rearward apartment, which was bedroom, breakfast-room, dining-room, and library, combined.

The balmy summer air, the restful quiet, the odor of the flowers, and the drowsing
murmur of the bees had had their effect, and she was nodding over her
knitting--for she had no company but the cat, and it was asleep in her lap.
Her spectacles were propped up on her gray head for safety.

She had thought that of course Tom had deserted long ago, and she wondered at
seeing him place himself in her power again in this intrepid way.
Mayn't I go and play now, aunt?
